Through the continuous practice, student will construct the basic logic of the program design, and the ability of computation think and practice application. At the final, a topic related to the application of students' professional subjects will be completed in groups, and student will learn how to use the program to solve problems in the relevant fields.

name.zh: Python 程式設計概論與應用

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 透過一系列的資料採集、參考與互動，包含經驗分享、影片欣賞等，帶領修課同學探索創新（Innovation）、創業（Startup）以及最重要的 – 創業家創新精神（Entrepreneur Innovative Thinking）之本質。無論是工作上的創造，學習上的創造，或者是 (創) 事業上的創造，都必然需要一定程度的創新，才能在全球化競爭以及指數型科技（Exponential Technology）發展的趨勢下存活，最終獲得勝利、創造價值。
description.en: Through series of classes to train students embracing the innovative thinking and gradually internalize it to become innovative entrepreneurship. Since the generation is changing so rapidly, the competitors are no longer came from local land but from everywhere in global village. Under this highly competitive world, every one of us need to fully embrace the true value of innovation, and incubate our own entrepreneurship with hack spirit, which will lead us to an island of innovation.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業核心。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 以視覺藝術為探討重點，研究藝術起源以及原始美術、民俗與大眾藝術分野。探究式覺元素和設計原理以及應用媒材、使用技巧，涵蓋素描、水彩、油畫、版畫、混合媒材、雕塑、建築，廣告、包裝、服裝設計、工業產品設計及攝影等。配合幻燈教學，使同學對於視覺藝術有整體性、概括性的認識，以奠定將來從事藝術鑑賞和研究創造之基礎。
description.en: The focus of this course is the exploration of visual arts.  Students will study the origin of art and the distinction among primitive art, folk and popular art. This course also provides students with visual elements, design principles, applied media material, and techniques including charcoal drawing, water-colored painting, oil painting, graphic art, compound material, sculpture, architecture, advertisement, packaging, fashion design, industrial design, and photography. Slide teaching is adopted to give students a comprehensive and general understanding on visual art in order to foster students to appreciate, study, and create art.

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 本課程是為非專業學生所設計的哲學概論，介紹西洋哲學的起源、西洋哲學的問題，以及哲學與人生的關係。哲學的問題意識起自人類的自覺，人類意圖認識自己，為宇宙人生尋求解答，哲學的發生本自人類天賦的求知欲，即其本性中對於智慧的追求與愛慕。這種愛慕智慧的精神是希臘文明留給西方世界的遺產，對於知識能持客觀批判的精神，對於真理能存認真熱切的態度，對於人生能有超克苦難的修持。在國際化的世代，我們對西方的認識應更深入其精神層面，此乃本課程規劃的初衷。
description.en: This course is designed for student who is not disciplined in philosophy. As an introduction, we begin at the origin of western philosophy, the philosophical questions and finally, the relationship of human life and philosophy. Philosophy takes place when human being thinking of himself. Man by nature desire to know himself as well as the external world. And due to this love of wisdom, men can be critical to knowledge and be passionate toward truth. Eventually, grasping the sprit of western philosophy , we can view our life in quite a different view. In our time, facing the world of international, we should better understand the western culture, which is rooted in philosophy.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 台灣位處東南亞與東北亞島弧的中介點，是亞洲大陸與太平洋的接點，因此，歷來有許多不同族群移居，因而形成多彩多樣的多元價值觀並容兼蓄的文化觀。本課程將論述介紹台灣南島文化、荷西殖民時期的基督教、漢人文化、日本文化和近代文明等在台灣社會產生的影響。
description.en: The island of Taiwan is located in the middle of the island arc of Southeastern and Northeastern Asia. Further, it is the intersection of the Asian continent and the Pacific Ocean. Since many different ethnic groups have migrated in together, a multi-dimensional view of value-colorful in itself has thus been formed. This course will make a first-step introduction and discussion on the impact over the Taiwan society processed by the cultural mix of the Austronesians, the Christianity under the occupation of the Netherlands and Spain, the Hans, the Japanese and the modern civilization.

name.en: The History and Culture of Taiwan

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 新經濟與舊經濟的分野不是在有『e』還是沒有『e』，而是在有『i』還是沒有『i』，而『i』就是『Innovation，創新』。二十一世紀的『腦力經濟』最重要的戲規則就是『智慧財產權』，同時也是 WTO 會員國必須遵守的重要規範之一。課程內容主要包括三個最基本的智慧財產權課題：專利權，商標權，以及著作權；而為配合本校學生學科背景，本課程將較著重於『專利』方面的實務知識，並且講授『如何激發創意，以培養學生日後能好好應用『智慧財產權』的保護。
description.en: The difference between New-economy and Old-economy is not caused by having "e" or not having "e", but caused by owining "i" or not owning "i". where "I" means "Innovation:.  Intellectual Property is not only the most importance business rule of the :Brain economy era:, but also one of the most important agreements among WTO members.  This course includes the basic three subjects of Intellectual Property:Patent, Trademark, and Copyright.  In order to accommodate the learning background for most of NTUT students, the contents of this course will focus more on the practical practice of the Patennt.  In addition, it also includes the subject of "how to activate your creativeness:so as to make students can use what they learn, "Intellectual Property:, to protect their intellectual work.

notes: 106-108：民主與法治核心。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 「社會心理學」主要探討的重點在於日常生活，社會刺激以及情境如何影響個人行為，它需要經過科學的方法進行研究，藉以預測一個人在某種情境下，可能會出現哪些行為。其涉及的學科相當廣泛，除了一般心理學的理論之外，尚包含社會科學哲學、文化人類學、倫理學、環境心理學、團體動力學等相關論述。課程強調理論與實務結合，提升學生參與社會的知能。
description.en: Social Psychology is focus on social stimuli and how situations affect individual behavior everyday life. In order to predict a person’s behavior in a situation, we need to research by scientific methods.  It covers a wide range of professional areas, not only the theories of social psychology but also philosophy of social science, cultural anthropology, ethics, environmental psychology, group dynamics. This course emphasizes the combination of theory and practice to enhance students’ abilities to participate in society.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 每個人都不想孤獨地活著，學習建立親密關係是幸福的來源。本課程透過講解、討論、體驗、分享，幫助學生認識自己，發揮最大潛能，懂得溝通連結，能處理情緒與壓力，尊重個別差異與性別平等，從而尋覓最對的人。在親密關係中鼓勵彼此做最真最喜歡的自己，也樂於分工合作，建立最美好的家庭，進而活出有意義有價值的人生。本課程是真正的成年禮，從自我到互依，是成長與成熟的必修課。
description.en: Nobody wants to live a lonely life. Having an intimate relationship is a source of happiness.In this course, students will be given a skill set for understanding themselves, exploring their potential and managing emotional stress. They will also learn to communicate and connect with others through personal sharing, group discussions and in-class exercises. Issues like individual difference and gender equality will be emphasized, since respecting each other is the base for any good relationship, not to mention finding the right partner.It is only when both partners are true to themselves and like the way they are in the relationship will they be willing to share the hard and fun work of building a family and living a meaningful life together.One can see this course as a rite of passage into adulthood.  It is a prerequisite for growing mature, from being self-centered to being able to rely on one another.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 在日常生活中經常會見到統計的應用，在讀取許多統計數據之時，我們必須要具有基本的統計概念才不會被數據所誤導。本課程利用 Excel 統計分析的功能，介紹基本的統計方法，藉由生活中應用之實例，將問卷設計、資料蒐集與分析、統計結果之解釋等，做一系列之介紹。
description.en: We usually use statistics in our daily life, but in many cases, we should have basic statistic concept, otherwise we maybe misleading by the data.  In this lesson, we use statistic analysis function of Excel as a useful tool.  Introduce basic method of statistic, show the procedure of questionnaire design, data collection and analysis, explanation of result etc., by use the example in our daily life.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 新創事業面臨許多的挑戰，包括：避孼與大企業競爭，找到存活的依據、從無到創立強勢品牌、創立或擴張自有市場 / 消費者據點等。本課程旨在啟發修課同學創業的興趣並協助修課同學思考新創事業如何平衡有限資源以迎向挑戰。新創企業已發展成熟的企業是不一樣，主要是因為新創事業的資源有限，創業家必須同時兼顧許多面向並回應顧客所需。本課程旨在協助修課同學思考創建企業應注意的各種面向評估自己的創能力。課程包含了三大部份，第一部份為創新與創業概念啟發；第二部份在辨別市場機會與發展市場；最後第三部份為新創事業行銷管理。行銷活動能夠將企業的產品及服務傳遞給顧客；並將產品、服務及企業本身的資訊帶到市場上；將顧客資訊回饋給企業。創業行銷管理能夠幫助創業者向潛在投資者及企業夥伴銷售創意以獲得資源，也讓創業家透過創新的商業手法來充分利用稀少的資源。
description.en: Managers must have excellent leadership skills in order to A start-up company has lots of challenges, such as: niche market located and brand diffusion. The course intends to encourage the participant to become an entrepreneur and handle with these challenges. A start-up company is different from well-developed one due to limited resources. Usually, to response customer’s requirement, the entrepreneur must take multiple criteria into consideration simultaneously.    The course includes three parts. Part I build students’ concept about innovation and entrepreneurship. Part II is about market identification. Part III is about marketing management of a start-up company. The efficient marketing activities enable business to approach customer’s requirement, to bring their customer product (or services) and get customer’s feedback. Also, the marketing management helps entrepreneur to reach their potential investor to obtain more resources.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業核心。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 本課程以培養學生尊重與欣賞不同族群、不同時空、不同價值觀所產生的音樂而設。藉由對音樂元素、本質的認知及介紹，欣賞各時期作曲家之代表作品，培養西方音樂的基本常識，建立音樂欣賞的專業態度。教學目標：1. 提高學生音樂欣賞的素養，充實其音樂生活的內涵，2. 激發學生對音樂的興趣，培育愛樂人口，增進社會祥和的原動力，3. 介紹古今中外音樂名家名作，啟發學生對音樂創作的認知與敬重，4. 建立學生對古典音樂、民族音樂、應用音樂及通俗音樂等不同類型音樂的正確認知與包容力，培養世界性的音樂觀。授課內容：1. 概論，2. 歌樂，3. 器樂，4. 儀式音樂，5. 舞蹈音樂，6. 戲劇音樂。
description.en: This course aims to cultivate students' ability to appreciate music of different ethnic groups, different time and place, different value systems. Through the introduction of basic music elements as well as the appreciation of the masterpieces of various composers, it is hoped that students will build up basic music knowledge about music and enhance professional music appreciation potentiality in music. The goals include: 1. Elevating students' capability in music appreciation 2. Inspiring students' interest in music with a view to improving our society into a harmonious world. 3. Introducing domestic and international famous composers' pieces 4. Touring of various forms of music: classical, ethnic, applied and popular music. Contents of this course include: 1.Introduction 2. Vocal music 3. Instrumental music 4. Ritual music 5. Dance music 6. Theatre music

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 近百年是台灣政治、社會、經濟、文化劇烈變動的時代。從清季西洋勢力的大舉進入，清廷推動自強新政以應變；爾後台灣淪入殖民統治，在近代化及同化政策下台灣的變革更為迅速；而從台灣光復迄今，不論是經濟發展、政治民主、教育普及等等，使台灣進入已開發國家之林。這些變革與發展，是台灣民眾集體努力的總成績，但其間也有許多引領風騷的人物，他們分佈於各個不同的領域，歷史家對他們的評價或正或負，成就與貢獻的多寡也有爭議，不過透過這些人物事蹟的探討，可了解個人與群體、時代、環境的互動關係，也更能掌握近百年台灣史發展的脈絡。
description.en: Never has Taiwan experienced so big changes in politics, social structures, economics and cultural movements as in the last century. In Ching Dynasty, the Westernized power entered and the Ching court initiated innovative campaigns to work against; then Taiwan under the colonial rule by Japan, modernization  and colonialism changes Taiwan a lot ; in past half century KMT's rule has advanced such great deal in the fields of economic development, democracy and education as to stand among the developed countries. Though it is the collective efforts of the Taiwanese people that contribute to the alteration and development, there exist some of the outstanding figures in various fields, who might receive positive as well as negative comments from the historians and who might initiate a controversy concerning their contribution. This course explores the most influential individuals and the events that happen around, in the hope to understand the interaction between each of them and the groups

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 「生活美學」是現代人依據東西方文化及各方美學的定義所推論出來的名詞，指應用於「生活」中食、衣、住、行、育、樂所體現美的內容及活動。依循相異的生活型態、社會環境，人類試圖重構生活藝術化與藝術生活化的當代美學。
description.en: “Aesthetics of living " will address the East-West cultural and aesthetic experience through series of questions that drive the discourse in contemporary life’s content and activities. Following the different lifestyles, social environment, human tries to reconstruct everyday life into contemporary aesthetics of living. This course aims to encourage students to think what is aesthetic of living, through the real life and spiritual life and concerned itself with the aesthetic problems in the lives of others.

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 新經濟與舊經濟的分野不是在有『e』還是沒有『e』，而是在有『i』還是沒有『i』，而『i』就是『Innovation，創新』。二十一世紀的『腦力經濟』最重要的戲規則就是『智慧財產權』，同時也是 WTO 會員國必須遵守的重要規範之一。課程內容主要包括三個最基本的智慧財產權課題：專利權，商標權，以及著作權；而為配合本校學生學科背景，本課程將較著重於『專利』方面的實務知識，並且講授『如何激發創意，以培養學生日後能好好應用『智慧財產權』的保護。
description.en: The difference between New-economy and Old-economy is not caused by having "e" or not having "e", but caused by owining "i" or not owning "i". where "I" means "Innovation:.  Intellectual Property is not only the most importance business rule of the :Brain economy era:, but also one of the most important agreements among WTO members.  This course includes the basic three subjects of Intellectual Property:Patent, Trademark, and Copyright.  In order to accommodate the learning background for most of NTUT students, the contents of this course will focus more on the practical practice of the Patennt.  In addition, it also includes the subject of "how to activate your creativeness:so as to make students can use what they learn, "Intellectual Property:, to protect their intellectual work.

notes: 106-108：民主與法治核心。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 本課程嘗試在教學現場中透過數學建模的專題，進而讓學生了解一個數學模型的建立，並透過數學工具的建立，對於建立模型後所產生的最佳解的設定，亦讓學生在教學現場中獲得一些主動分析的能力，也跟現實社會做連結，以作為改善研究型跟實務型教學上的落差，讓學生更了解數學的實用性。
description.en: This course tries to use the topic of mathematical modeling in the teaching site to let students understand the establishment of a mathematical model, and through the establishment of mathematical tools, the setting of the best solution generated after the model is established, also allows students to be in the teaching site Acquiring some active analytical skills in the school, and also connecting with the real world, as a way to improve the gap between research-based and practical teaching, so that students can better understand the practicality of mathematics.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 台灣位處東南亞與東北亞島弧的中介點，是亞洲大陸與太平洋的接點，因此，歷來有許多不同族群移居，因而形成多彩多樣的多元價值觀並容兼蓄的文化觀。本課程將論述介紹台灣南島文化、荷西殖民時期的基督教、漢人文化、日本文化和近代文明等在台灣社會產生的影響。
description.en: The island of Taiwan is located in the middle of the island arc of Southeastern and Northeastern Asia. Further, it is the intersection of the Asian continent and the Pacific Ocean. Since many different ethnic groups have migrated in together, a multi-dimensional view of value-colorful in itself has thus been formed. This course will make a first-step introduction and discussion on the impact over the Taiwan society processed by the cultural mix of the Austronesians, the Christianity under the occupation of the Netherlands and Spain, the Hans, the Japanese and the modern civilization.

name.en: The History and Culture of Taiwan

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 倫理學 (Ethics) 是討論「應不應該」的一門哲學分支。倫理學可分為「微觀倫理學」：探討個人性之行為的應不應該的問題，以及「宏觀的倫理學」：探討整個社會的政治、經濟、法律、社會等方面的問題。倫理學亦可區分為「規範倫理學」及「應用倫理學」兩大類，前者探討善的定義與判斷準則、動機論與結果論、人的意志是否自由、決定論與責任、自律與他律、幸福與快樂、哪些德行 (virtue) 值得追求等等課題，後者則是運用倫理學觀點探討諸如安樂死、墮胎、環保、複製人等種種課題。本課程主要目的是在對倫理學課題與種類作一個基本的介紹，訓練及培養學生在倫理問題上思考的能力，期能讓學生在作道德問題的判斷與抉擇上能夠有所進步。
description.en: This course will introduce basic ideas of Ethics to students. The topics will include: the definition and criterion of good, motivation and consequence, the problem of free will, determinism and responsibility, autonomy and discipline by others, happiness and pleasure, and virtues. This course will also touch upon those issues in applied Ethics, such as abortion, environment, business ethics, death sentence, etc.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 個人或國家都無法自外於當今的國際社會；政治、經濟、社會、文化各層面皆受到國際間互動的影響下，為增進知識青年具備國際化的視野與認知，以因應時代發展趨勢，在強化技術研究的基礎上，拓展國家、社會與個人的發展空間。本課程內容包括基本理論與國際關係的動態，涵蓋國際社會的結構與演變、國際行為的類型及支配此行為的各種力量、國際事務的現象、本質及因果關係。
description.en: An individual or a country may not keep alien to today's internatonal community. Owing to internationally interactive influence with respect to politic, economy, society and culture, the purpose of the course is to equip intellectual youths with internaitonalized sight and awareness to keep pace with the develolpment trend of times, and to expand the space for national, social and individual development on basic of reinforced technical research. The contents of the course include basic theory and the situation  of international relations, covering the structure and changes in the international community, the type of international behavior, and various forces dominating such behavior, the phenomenon, essence, cause and consequence of international affairs.

notes: 106-108：民主與法治選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 本課程探討介紹勞工問題及勞資爭議的基本概念，同時輔以相關案例的檢討分析，以提升學生對於問題的了解，同時幫助學生學習職場溝通，以建立和諧及合作的勞資關係。
description.en: The main  purpose  of  the  course   is  to  discuss  about  problems  arising  from  labor  relation  and  how  to  settle  it  . This  course  focuses  on  the  introduction  to  the  fundamental  ideas  of  labor  problems  and  labor  disputes .  Many  relevant  cases  are  presented  in  class  for  further  discussion  and  analysis  .  It  also  helps  students  to  communicate  with  other  people  in  work  place  so  as  to  establish  a  harmonic  and  cooperative  industrial  relationship .

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 此門課程主要在於瞭解社會學的意涵，並藉由跨領域的學習，讓不同學科能有對話的空間。課程涵蓋的範圍會兼顧理論與實用性，讓學生能思考當今的社會，理解到產生因素的多元性，並進而使個人眼界能更加開拓。期望學生於課程學習中能夠擁有更多對於整個社會的不同思維，以強化本身學科之所需，不但具有理論性深入的洞察力，也能引用到管理上實質的層面。
description.en: The purpose of this course is to understand sociology. It covers theory and practicability, and make students consider the current society, and understand the generated factors of diversity . Expect students' study can have more for the community as a whole different way of thinking, in order to strengthen their academic needs, not only has the theoretical depth of insight, but also on the substance applied to the management level.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學核心。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 現代科技文明進展得非常迅速，這使得一般人日常生活中，可能經常享受到這些科技所帶來的便利，但卻習以為常，以為天生下來就是這樣的，這些現代的科技，可能是關於電機的、物理的、化工的、光電的、材料的......，更有可能同時涉及了其他許多個領域，更可能有許多人希望能夠了解這些科技的來龍去脈，一窺其究竟，人類在沒有土木工程學之前，早已能建築萬里長城和金字塔，許許多多的科技是由嘗試錯誤，經驗的累積逐漸得來的，當然，隨著知識的不斷窮究其理，"知而後行" 的高科技也就會越來越多，我們在這裡也試圖去追蹤各項科技的演進史與現況方面讓大家知道羅馬不是一天所造成的，另一方面也讓大家有從另一個角度重新思考的機會，也許這些科技進化到現在，還稱不上成熟的階段，您也許可以找出另一種更好的方法來改進它們！
description.en: Modern technology is growing fast. People thus enjoy the convenience in company with the technology—which they do and they just take it for granted to do. It may have something to do with electrical engineering, physics, chemical engineering, electro-optical engineering, materials…Some problems involves more than one field. People are curious about the technology and willing to know how to solve the problems. Human beings are able to build the pyramids and the Long Walls before they know anything about civil engineering—knowledge actually piled up by trial and error or accumulated experience. As knowledge expands, hi-end technology which requires “know-how” becomes more popular. In this course, we try to trace the history and the current situations: “Rome was not built in a day.” On the other hand, we might take another chance to RE-think a deeper problem: technology evolves without getting to maturity. Human beings will be enforced to find some other ways to improve it.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 生命科學概論，重心放在人體生命科學，並強化醫學的角色。此外，中西醫結合的觀點，詮釋抗老、防癌。以身心靈養生的方式，強化預防醫學。並從人類疾病的本源性病因，根本探討。當然，如何增強免疫力，袪除自由基是主軸。在探究人體潛能、身心靈養生或疾病的本源性原因時，都必須重視「經絡」系統。總之生命是非常奧妙的，不僅只物質面，更要重視心靈層面，中西醫整合方向，必是廿一世紀的主流。
description.en: This course focuses on human life science and emphasizes the roles of medicine on improving the life quality of human beings. It also uses the point of view of integration traditional Chinese and western medicine to interpret how to prevent the aging of body and occurrence of cancers. This course also focuses on how to keep the body, mind and spirit in the best conditon in order to prevent the occurrence of human diseases. In addition, it deeply discusses the eseential etiology of human disease and teaches audiences how to enhance the body immunity and how to get rid of free radicals. The importance of meridian system of the human body and its relationships to human potentiality, body, mind spirit and diseses are also discussed. Life is marvelous. The completeness of life depends on the saisfaction of not only the material but also menetal and spiritual needs. Integration of the traditional Chinese and western medicine to improve the life quality of human beings is the main issue.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學核心。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 創業與財務概論課程的主要目的是要使學生了解如何在企業創立的時候，透過財務技術，來評估企業的經營績效與價值。本課程將介紹以下內容：(1) 公司創業的財務報表與科目報導與分析 (2) 基本創業財務分析理論 (3) 公司的償債能力、獲利能力、經營能力、資本結構、現金流量的分析 (4) 特殊行業的財務報表分析 (5) 探討我國最近發佈的會計準則公報對企業與投資人的影響。
description.en: The goal of the introduction to entrepreneurship and finance course is to help students, when the company is in the stage of entrepreneurship, evaluate the performance and measure the values of firms by financial statements. The topics of this course includes (1) entrepreneurship financial reports and analysis; (2) basic entrepreneurship financial statement analysis; 3) solvency, profitability, business performance, financial structure and cash flow analysis; 4) financial statement analysis of special industries 5) recent developments of GAAP.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業選修。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 本課程將分理論、作品研讀與實地操作三部份。先有對於口述歷史理論基本的認識，再研究選讀近年來的口述歷史作品，透過這些作品瞭解部份歷史，並找出感興趣的題材，在以上理論與實例示範的基礎之下，學生自己擬定口述主題與進行方式，在課堂報告討論之後「下田野」去進行實際的調查，期末再將成果報告出來。
description.en: The main topics for class discussion include of: oral history theory, works and doing. First, students will learn about oral history theory. Second, we will discuss some oral history works, and realize with a part of history through those oral works. Students will find some interesting topics and make a plane to do it. And then we ask students to be an interviewee and make an interview with those people that they have chosen.

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 本課程以培養學生尊重與欣賞不同族群、不同時空、不同價值觀所產生的音樂而設。藉由對音樂元素、本質的認知及介紹，欣賞各時期作曲家之代表作品，培養西方音樂的基本常識，建立音樂欣賞的專業態度。教學目標：1. 提高學生音樂欣賞的素養，充實其音樂生活的內涵，2. 激發學生對音樂的興趣，培育愛樂人口，增進社會祥和的原動力，3. 介紹古今中外音樂名家名作，啟發學生對音樂創作的認知與敬重，4. 建立學生對古典音樂、民族音樂、應用音樂及通俗音樂等不同類型音樂的正確認知與包容力，培養世界性的音樂觀。授課內容：1. 概論，2. 歌樂，3. 器樂，4. 儀式音樂，5. 舞蹈音樂，6. 戲劇音樂。
description.en: This course aims to cultivate students' ability to appreciate music of different ethnic groups, different time and place, different value systems. Through the introduction of basic music elements as well as the appreciation of the masterpieces of various composers, it is hoped that students will build up basic music knowledge about music and enhance professional music appreciation potentiality in music. The goals include: 1. Elevating students' capability in music appreciation 2. Inspiring students' interest in music with a view to improving our society into a harmonious world. 3. Introducing domestic and international famous composers' pieces 4. Touring of various forms of music: classical, ethnic, applied and popular music. Contents of this course include: 1.Introduction 2. Vocal music 3. Instrumental music 4. Ritual music 5. Dance music 6. Theatre music

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 本課程旨在培養學生成為具有豐富文學素養的科技人。引導學生如何探索文學作品，認識各種不同類型文學作品的發展歷程，以及每個重要發展階段的寫作理念，指標作家與作品。課程中將探討東西方古今詩詞、散文、小說、戲劇等文學類型的特點，透過分析作品，解讀作品，奠立遨遊世界文學堂奧的基礎。
description.en: The main purpose of this course is to enrich the literary taste of our technology majored students. The teachers would guide the students to explore the master pieces in the literary world, to know the different types of works with their development, and also the main writing theory in each period. Of course, the representative writers and their works would be introduced. During the course, regardless of the characters of western, east or ancient, modern literature, including poem, essay, novel and drama, would all be discussed. Through the internalization and reading the articles, the students might lay a foundation in the grand universal literary world.

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 「生活美學」是現代人依據東西方文化及各方美學的定義所推論出來的名詞，指應用於「生活」中食、衣、住、行、育、樂所體現美的內容及活動。依循相異的生活型態、社會環境，人類試圖重構生活藝術化與藝術生活化的當代美學。
description.en: “Aesthetics of living " will address the East-West cultural and aesthetic experience through series of questions that drive the discourse in contemporary life’s content and activities. Following the different lifestyles, social environment, human tries to reconstruct everyday life into contemporary aesthetics of living. This course aims to encourage students to think what is aesthetic of living, through the real life and spiritual life and concerned itself with the aesthetic problems in the lives of others.

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 人際關係是探討對自我的了解及對人的認知，包括性格、態度、魅力、溝通、壓力、挫折和情緒等重要課題的處理；幫助同學學習與各種不同品味、信念、立場與生活方式的人作有效率的溝通，開放的表達出自己的感覺與想法，以建立良好的合作關係，從而開發潛能、爭取更好的發展機會。
description.en: Interpersonal Relationship is to discuss about self-understanding and perception of other people, including how to handle key issues related to character, attitude, attractiveness, communication, pressure, frustration and emotion.  It helps students to learn effective communication, open their minds to express personal feeling and thought, and try to communicate with other people having different tastes, convictions, standpoints and ways of living so as to establish a harmonic and cooperative relationship and furtherly to develop personal potential and strive for better opportunity of development.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 大眾傳播與人類社會的關係，正隨科技的進步而日益擴大它的影響力。根據學者研究發現，人類的思想、態度與價值觀念受大眾傳播的影響日漸加深，大傳媒介不但塑造人的思想，同時也影響人們的行為及價值；然而從傳播的功能言，大眾傳播同時具有正面與負面的社會功能，故大眾傳播的發展與過程，殊值重視與探討。本課程兼顧理論與實例的探討，包括傳播特性與要素、大眾傳播的能及效果、新聞守門人理論等，並以實例分析新聞的公正客觀性、新聞自由與國家安全、媒體與選舉等傳播爭議性問題。修習本課程可培養學生閱讀新聞的正確性，不玫人云亦云，受媒體報導所擺佈；同時亦可增強學生人際溝通的技巧與能力。
description.en: With the advancement of technology, mass communication is enlarging its influence in human society.  According to  researches, the thoughts, attitudes and value judgements of humans are deeply affected by mass communication.  The media not only shape persons' thoughts, but also have an impact on their behavior and values.  Since mass communication has positive and negative social functions at the same time, its development and process are therefore worthy of paying much attention and exploration to us.  This course includes the study of the theory and practice of mass communication, such as characteristics and elements functions and effects, as well as the theory of the news gatekeepers.  It also uses stories to analyze disputed issues, for example, news objectivism, freedom of the press and national security, and media and election.  Learning this course, students will be not only capable of cultivating the ability to read a news correctl

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 本課程探討介紹勞工問題及勞資爭議的基本概念，同時輔以相關案例的檢討分析，以提升學生對於問題的了解，同時幫助學生學習職場溝通，以建立和諧及合作的勞資關係。
description.en: The main  purpose  of  the  course   is  to  discuss  about  problems  arising  from  labor  relation  and  how  to  settle  it  . This  course  focuses  on  the  introduction  to  the  fundamental  ideas  of  labor  problems  and  labor  disputes .  Many  relevant  cases  are  presented  in  class  for  further  discussion  and  analysis  .  It  also  helps  students  to  communicate  with  other  people  in  work  place  so  as  to  establish  a  harmonic  and  cooperative  industrial  relationship .

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 此門課程主要在於瞭解社會學的意涵，並藉由跨領域的學習，讓不同學科能有對話的空間。課程涵蓋的範圍會兼顧理論與實用性，讓學生能思考當今的社會，理解到產生因素的多元性，並進而使個人眼界能更加開拓。期望學生於課程學習中能夠擁有更多對於整個社會的不同思維，以強化本身學科之所需，不但具有理論性深入的洞察力，也能引用到管理上實質的層面。
description.en: The purpose of this course is to understand sociology. It covers theory and practicability, and make students consider the current society, and understand the generated factors of diversity . Expect students' study can have more for the community as a whole different way of thinking, in order to strengthen their academic needs, not only has the theoretical depth of insight, but also on the substance applied to the management level.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學核心。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 本課程之目標為：充實生活技能、提升科技素養、豐富生活內涵、培養繼續進修之興趣與能力，以奠定終身學習及生涯發展之基礎。本課程之內容為：一、電腦基本概念，二、電腦功能與應用，三、資料處理，四、資訊管理，五、資訊網路，六、電腦的聲光世界，七、電腦的安全問題與防治，八、未來的資訊社會。
description.en: This course is designed to help student to learn another skill, better understand technology, enrich there live and inspire their interests for further study. The course includes: 1.basic knowledge of computer; 2.the application of computer; 3.data procession; 4.data control; 5.internet; 6.multimedia; 7.computer virus; 8. the world of information.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 學習邏輯推理主要的目的便是幫助我們培養一種邏輯能力，使我們能夠為我們的人生做出正確的判斷。本課程包括：邏輯的基本觀念，真值表推論法，語句邏輯中自然演繹法的 18 條基本推論規則，語句邏輯的基本公理系統，量化邏輯中自然演繹法的基本規論推測，量化邏輯的詮釋方法，量化邏輯的基本公理系統，語句邏輯的後設理論，量化邏輯的後設理論，傳統的三段論法，謬誤理論、與介於自然與形式語言之間的翻譯等等。
description.en: The main purpose of studying "Logical Inference" is to help us obtain a kind of logical ability, by means of which we will be able to make right choices for our life. This courses covers at least the following topics: basic ideas in logic, the truth table method, 18 basic rules of inference in the method of natural deduction in sentential logic, basic axiomatic systems in sentential logic, basic rules of inference in the method of natural deduction in quantificational logic, interpretations in quantificational logic, basic axiomatic systems in quantificational logic, meta-theorem in sentential logic, meta-theorem in quantificational logic, traditional syllogism, the fallacy theory, and the translation between natural and formal language, etc.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學核心。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 透過一系列的資料採集、參考與互動，包含經驗分享、影片欣賞等，帶領修課同學探索創新（Innovation）、創業（Startup）以及最重要的 – 創業家創新精神（Entrepreneur Innovative Thinking）之本質。無論是工作上的創造，學習上的創造，或者是 (創) 事業上的創造，都必然需要一定程度的創新，才能在全球化競爭以及指數型科技（Exponential Technology）發展的趨勢下存活，最終獲得勝利、創造價值。
description.en: Through series of classes to train students embracing the innovative thinking and gradually internalize it to become innovative entrepreneurship. Since the generation is changing so rapidly, the competitors are no longer came from local land but from everywhere in global village. Under this highly competitive world, every one of us need to fully embrace the true value of innovation, and incubate our own entrepreneurship with hack spirit, which will lead us to an island of innovation.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業核心。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 探討各種家具材料之種類與特性，以木質材料為主，輔以金屬、塑膠、 玻璃、石材及其他配件，充分瞭解各種材料之優良特性，配合正確的加工方式及人性化設計，俾使家具產品於適當之使用環境下得以適材適用，發揮最大經濟效益。
description.en: Introduction to the varieties and characteristics of materials for making furniture. Wood material, the key portion of this course, includes the macrostructure and microstructure of wood, identification and uses of common softwoods and hardwoods, physical and mechanical properties in relation to wood processing, properties of other wood based materials such as particleboard, fiberboard, plywood, laminated wood related to their use in furniture manufacture also included, and accompanied with other materials such as metal, plastic, glass, stone and accessories. This course intends to survey the specific properties of various materials and right processing way to achieve the best economic benefits.

notes: 工設三四合開；上限 25 人；新聘

description.zh: 梁任公說：「孔子這個人有多少價值，連帶的論語也有多少價值。」所以論語是瞭解孔子最好的一部古經典。本課程旨在透過論語誘使學者對孔子的精神面貌有一番真切的體認，並使學者由而知曉儒家何以能深深影響著二千多年來國人的思想言行。
description.en: As Qishau Liang states, "Lueng Yu is as valuable as Confucius." Therefore, Lung Yu is the best classics, which provide easy access to deepening the understanding of Confucius. The course aim at sharpening students' knowledge about Confucius and Confucian school that has exerted profound influence on Chinese for over two thousand years.

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 古蹟是人類歷史發展過程中所留下來的具體構造物，它是歷史的見證，也是文化的軌跡。在台灣發展史上從早期的原住民社會到漢人移民大量進入台灣，及十七世紀後歷經不同政權的統治，每個時期均留下不少的古蹟，這些古蹟是文化發展的具體證據，是了解台灣歷史與文化的最佳途徑，而透過古蹟的探索可進一步增進傳統的建築、藝術、民俗、文物等各方面的知識，使學生從中體會先民來台的艱辛與其生活的智慧，培育其珍視先民文物史蹟的情懷。
description.en: Historical sites are the concrete structures, left behind by the historical development of human beings. They are genuine witnesses of history and the cultural tracks as well. In the history of Taiwan, quite a few historical sites built in different phases remain existent: from the early aboriginal society via the big migration of the Hans to the various periods of sovereignty since 17th century. The sites turn out to be important evidence of cultural growth, the easiest access to the understanding of Taiwanese history and culture. A thorough explore into the historical sites helps a lot to broaden our knowledge in the conventional architectures, arts, folklore and cultural objects. This course also helps us to realize the hardships of life our forefathers encounter and the wisdom they acquire, in the hope to grow a better sense to treasure the past culture and the objects available to them.

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 本課程關注的焦點將以都市文學和民族 / 文化 / 現代建構為基底，以 “五四” 文學以來的總體概述為起始的一個發現之旅。課程將以夏志清的中國現代小說史為起點，進而以李歐梵對於民國初年出版商和作家和他們的貢獻作為對照，來做為現代城市文化風景的呈現。課程中將以安德森” 想像的共同體” 為背景，解釋它被各種文化論述所引用的觀點，以各種面向來看待文學作品對於民族建構的貢獻。
description.en: We arrange the course that is based on urban literatures, with issues about the race, culture and the construction of the modern world. The students in the course will be guided into a tour of discovery, which is summed up and initiated from “May 4th Movement”. The progress of course will be mapped out from “A History of Modern Chinese Fiction” compiled by C. T. Hsia (夏志清), and then the analysis from Leo Lee, and other writers, will be compared to exhibit the style and features of modern urban literatures. According to the theory of “Imagined Communities” which is authored by B. Anderson, we will also explain the viewpoints from different cultures, and comment on the analyses to the race construction with varied points of view.

name.zh: 二十世紀中國現代文學與文化建構
name.en: The modern literature and cultural construction in twentieth century China

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 人際關係是探討對自我的了解及對人的認知，包括性格、態度、魅力、溝通、壓力、挫折和情緒等重要課題的處理；幫助同學學習與各種不同品味、信念、立場與生活方式的人作有效率的溝通，開放的表達出自己的感覺與想法，以建立良好的合作關係，從而開發潛能、爭取更好的發展機會。
description.en: Interpersonal Relationship is to discuss about self-understanding and perception of other people, including how to handle key issues related to character, attitude, attractiveness, communication, pressure, frustration and emotion.  It helps students to learn effective communication, open their minds to express personal feeling and thought, and try to communicate with other people having different tastes, convictions, standpoints and ways of living so as to establish a harmonic and cooperative relationship and furtherly to develop personal potential and strive for better opportunity of development.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 面對科技發展日新月異，社會急驟變遷的新世紀，只習得專業上的一技之長，已不足以和協圓滿地實踐有意義的人生。有鑑於此，乃以生涯發展與生涯諮商的理論與研究為基礎，配合學生的發展，希翼能透過教育的歷程，使學生的專業知識能和未來的工作與生活規劃，產生有意義的聯結，進而為學生提供一個短程與長程的生涯發展與選擇的準備與指引。授課內容包括生涯理念介紹、興趣、性格、價值觀探索，生涯決定因素，生涯技巧，生涯角色調適，生涯選擇與規劃技巧，生涯訪談，生涯高原調適，轉型期調適，性別、職業歧視，雙生涯家庭，就業準備等主要生涯課題的研討與習作。
description.en: In face of a new century with continuous scientific development and rapid social changes, to learn one single professional skill is not enough to fulfill a meaningful life in a harmonic and satisfactory manner. In view of this, based on the theory and research of career development and consultation in association with the development of students,  it is hoped to produce a meaningful linking between their professional knowledge and job and life planning through the course of eucation, and further to provide them a preparation and guide for short and long-range career development and choice. The contents of the course include the discussion and exercise related to major career topics such as introduction to the concept of career, the discussion of interest, character and value, decisive factors of career, skills of career, role adjustment in career, career choice and planning skill, career interview, uphill adjustment in career, adjustment in transit period, sex and occupation.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 「時間學」是一門相當實際的課程，其目的在教導學瞭解時間的意義，提升時間使用的價值以善用時間，充實自己的生命與生活。本課程內容提供時間理論相關的觀念與方法，希望同學於課程中，一方面從學中做，一方面從做中學，而達到「時間學」增進個人健康，促進人際關係，有效處理公私事宜的三大功能。
description.en: "Time Science" is a very practical course and its purpose is to teach students the meaning of time with a view to increasing the value of time utility so as to make good use of time and enrich one's own life and living.The contents of the course provide the concept and method relating to time ethic and hope students to learn and work so  that "Time Sciecne" may attain three major functions--increase personal physical and mental health, promote interpersonal relationship and effectively handle public/private affairs.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 工業化導致人口從鄉村往都市遷徙，其後果不只是在人類生活環境的改變或者是流行病學問題。都市化過程也造成自然環境改變，生物棲地減少的問題。該課程希望透過了解都市中生態棲地的改變，如何影響鳥類以及其他生物的生存，使學生意識到人類的都市化，對其他物種的衝擊。並從中思考，在便利的都會社會生活之外，該如何在都市生活中建設生態友善的校園。
description.en: Industrialization brings about domestic migration from rural areas to cities. The consequences include not only environmental changes for human life or related epidemiological issues. The process of urbanization also causes changes of natural environment, reducing habitat for wildlife. This course aims to provide students a scope to aware how habitat changes in urban areas impact birds and other wildlife and to design environment-friendly campus in additional to convenient urban social life.

notes: 106-108: 自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 本課程結合跨領域，從人文、藝術、音樂、設計、多媒體、金融，到生物、醫學、材料、電資、工程… 等各領域，導入如何利用人工智慧，加上量子計算應用到各層面上，以解決問題到科技研發創新。再介紹元宇宙的概念，然後結合各領域逐步完成元宇宙生態系的構建。
description.en: This course combines cross-fields, from humanities, art, music, design, multimedia, finance, to biology, medicine, materials, electricity, engineering... and other fields. Introduces how to use artificial intelligence and the application of quantum computing to solve problems and scientific innovation. Then introduce the concept of metaverse and gradually complete the construction of metaverse ecosystem.

name.zh: 人工智慧與量子計算應用介紹
name.en: Introduction to artificial intelligence and quantum computing

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 本課程教導學生了解新創事業在智慧財產權與專利管理的基本知識，課程的教導將朝下列方向進行: (1) 新創事業智慧財產權的基本觀念與實務， (2) 專利資訊分析，(3) 專利演化與發展 ，(4) 創意產出，(5) 專利申請與保護 (6) 專利佈局 (7) 專利侵權鑑定 (8) 專利迴避設計 (9) 案例討論與分析。
description.en: This course teaches students Intellectual Property Rights and patent management for Entrepreneurship. The course includes topics as follows: (1) Basic knowledge and practices of Entrepreneurship Intellectual Property Rights; (2) The analysis of patent information; (3) The evolution and development for patent; (4) Innovative idea generation; (5) Application and protection of patent (6) Patent strategy (7) Patent violation，(8) Patent avoidance，(9) Cases study.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業選修。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 本課程旨在闡明中國傳統思想之精義，疏通其中所涵蘊之問題，希望透過講授與討論，把握中國思想發展之大脈，並展望未來文化之發展。在課程設計方面，依序分先秦諸子、魏晉玄學、隋唐佛學、宋明學、近代思想五大綱領。深入淺出，直探本源，使學者領會中國歷代哲人之睿見，指引人生步上光明之大道。
description.en: This course deals mainly with the essence of Chinese traditional thought, trying to sovle the riddles lying behind the msytery of Asian philosophy. Through lectures and class discussion, students are expected to have a better command of the significant stream of thinking development for the Chinese people and look into the future cultural development. As for the course planning, this course consists of the following five topics: Pre-Chin philosophers, Taoism in Wei and Jin Dynasties, Buddism in Sui and Tang dynasties, Confucianism in Song and Ming Dynasties and modern philosophy. The course will be presented with simple approaches and lots of class discussions in the hope that  students will realize the wisdom explored by important philosophers throughout Chinese history, which will in returen provide students with much more promising and enrihed way of life.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 歷史相關研究蓬勃發展迄今，不論是史料或新舊的研究著作重新被重視、翻譯與詮釋，這些可稱之為史學著作的經典。這些書籍既有趣味又有意義，捧而讀之，中西歷史、古往今來的風物民情、地貌變遷等流轉仿彿躍於紙上。本課程將介紹這些經典的、趣味的、有意義的歷史名著，藉由數本好書，進而瞭解人類的歷史。
description.en: Since the study of the history has been in prosperity, a large number of historical texts have been newly translated and interpreted, thus gaining more importance. These texts can be categorized as classical volumes of history . There have been existent a lot of other written resources interesting and meaningful exhibiting the vivid image of the people, geography, folk stories and the transition of time available in history. This course focuses on these particular materials concerning the human history through the discussion of which, the history of mankind can be better understood.

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 人際關係是探討對自我的了解及對人的認知，包括性格、態度、魅力、溝通、壓力、挫折和情緒等重要課題的處理；幫助同學學習與各種不同品味、信念、立場與生活方式的人作有效率的溝通，開放的表達出自己的感覺與想法，以建立良好的合作關係，從而開發潛能、爭取更好的發展機會。
description.en: Interpersonal Relationship is to discuss about self-understanding and perception of other people, including how to handle key issues related to character, attitude, attractiveness, communication, pressure, frustration and emotion.  It helps students to learn effective communication, open their minds to express personal feeling and thought, and try to communicate with other people having different tastes, convictions, standpoints and ways of living so as to establish a harmonic and cooperative relationship and furtherly to develop personal potential and strive for better opportunity of development.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 本課程探討介紹勞工問題及勞資爭議的基本概念，同時輔以相關案例的檢討分析，以提升學生對於問題的了解，同時幫助學生學習職場溝通，以建立和諧及合作的勞資關係。
description.en: The main  purpose  of  the  course   is  to  discuss  about  problems  arising  from  labor  relation  and  how  to  settle  it  . This  course  focuses  on  the  introduction  to  the  fundamental  ideas  of  labor  problems  and  labor  disputes .  Many  relevant  cases  are  presented  in  class  for  further  discussion  and  analysis  .  It  also  helps  students  to  communicate  with  other  people  in  work  place  so  as  to  establish  a  harmonic  and  cooperative  industrial  relationship .

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 資訊法律課程將讓同學了解網路資訊社會中各層面的相關法律議題。本課程內容著重於各種網路法律問題，例如資訊安全、網路契約的訂定、網域名稱、數位化著作權、商標權，隱私權以及電腦犯罪種類及防治的介紹。另外，本課程也以個案方式，敘述電腦資訊的相關法律問題，並從中了解虛擬世界與現實世界的法律規範，同時測試自己是否具備足夠的資訊法律知識，能夠在快速變遷的資訊社會中立足與發展。
description.en: The course of Information Laws is designed for the students to familiarize such legal issues in most of the aspects available in the current world as information security, internet contracts, domain names, digital copy rights, trademark ownership, individual privacy and the genre & prevention in relation to computers. In addition, we discuss individual cases to further understand the nature of legal issues concerning computerized information. Hopefully, we learn the legal disciplines existent in the virtual and real worlds; besides, the students are supposed to equip themselves with sufficient legal knowledge so that they can survive and thus keep growing in the ever-changing information society.

notes: 106-108：民主與法治選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 藥膳在中醫理論指導下，將中草藥與實務相配合，運用傳統烹調技術和現代加工方法製成味、色、形俱佳的、更有保健和治療作用作之食品，其內容廣泛，迄今已有三千年之歷史。所謂藥食同源更是集中而深刻的體現了藥膳之重要性。本課程共分：湯膳概論、穀物湯膳、蔬菜湯膳、果品湯膳、畜肉湯膳、海鮮湯膳、藥草湯膳和美容養生湯膳等。
description.en: The Applied Nutrition of Life is two credit hours course and design especially for technology students. This curriculum emphasizes on the clinical applications and action mechanisms of various food cooking of Chinese drugs. The curriculum trends will start from more details and bring a completely concepts. The subjects include some Chinese food cooking contain Chinese herbal and some skill to how to select a good quality Chinese herbal.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 病毒可說是介於無生命和有生命之間的物質。它小至用光學顯微鏡看不見除非在電子顯微鏡下。儘管看不見卻無所不在，與人類關係異常密切。人類基因體約 8% 是從病毒來的。目前最難解決的傳染病問題也是由病毒引起。病毒結構看來似乎很簡單，但為了生存也進化出非凡的策略。人類從研究病毒得到非常多重要的知識和研究工具。讓我們能夠對分子、細胞和生物體的結構和功能得到更深地了解，進而對疾病問題得到解決。本課程將以深入簡出的方式讓同學認識病毒：從病毒的起源，病毒如何進入宿主細胞與複製，並在宿主群體間存活和傳播所必須具備的機制。通過一系列較具代表性的人類病毒為例子進行介紹病毒複製的基礎、人類與病毒的相互作用以及如何導致疾病。同時認識人體 4006 的孼疫系統如何對抗病毒。了解為什麼新興病毒的出現並造成疫情。人類應如何應對。最後介紹兩種不尋常的傳染因子 - 類病毒和狂牛病蛋白。它們與病毒似乎都是在生命起源中在化學演化時期殘留下來的分子。
description.en: Virus is between life and no-life substances. It is Invisible to the naked eye unless under an electron microscope. However, virus is existed everywhere and has a very close relationship with humans. 8% of the human genome comes from viruses. At present, the most difficult to solve infectious disease problem is caused by virus. Although the structure and composition seems simple, virus has evolved an extraordinary strategy for survival. Virology enable us to insight the structure and function of molecules, cells, and organisms. From studying virus, people has gained a lot of important knowledge and research tools, which help people solving disease problems. This course will emphasize the mechanisms necessary for the virus to successfully enter and reproduce in the host cell, and survive and spread in the host population. Through a series of representative examples of human viruses, I will introduce the general basis of virus replication, the interaction between the virus and the host,

name.en: An introduction to virology and unusual infectious agents

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 創業與財務概論課程的主要目的是要使學生了解如何在企業創立的時候，透過財務技術，來評估企業的經營績效與價值。本課程將介紹以下內容：(1) 公司創業的財務報表與科目報導與分析 (2) 基本創業財務分析理論 (3) 公司的償債能力、獲利能力、經營能力、資本結構、現金流量的分析 (4) 特殊行業的財務報表分析 (5) 探討我國最近發佈的會計準則公報對企業與投資人的影響。
description.en: The goal of the introduction to entrepreneurship and finance course is to help students, when the company is in the stage of entrepreneurship, evaluate the performance and measure the values of firms by financial statements. The topics of this course includes (1) entrepreneurship financial reports and analysis; (2) basic entrepreneurship financial statement analysis; 3) solvency, profitability, business performance, financial structure and cash flow analysis; 4) financial statement analysis of special industries 5) recent developments of GAAP.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業選修。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 創業者在新創事業時，同時須考慮新創事業之品牌建構，如果能在創業之初建構一個定位明確的品牌，可使新創事業立即享有良好的品牌權益，提高創業成功的機會。品牌建構完成後，須設計行銷方案，對消費者進行行銷活動，向消費者推銷新創公司之品牌，以塑造良好的品牌權益。此時，消費者對新創公司之品牌會有良好形象之認知，進而提升顧客對新創公司品牌忠誠度，增加創業者創業成功之機會。
description.en: When entrepreneurs are building a startup company, they also need to consider its brand building. If they can construct a clear positioning of the brand in the beginning, they are able to have their new business with a better brand equity immediately, and improve entrepreneurial chances of success.After the completion of construction of the brand, entrepreneurs need to design marketing programs for consumer marketing activities, and promote its brand to create good brand equity. In the meantime, consumers will have a better brand awareness of these new companies, enhancing customer loyalty and increasing opportunities for entrepreneurs’ entrepreneurial success.

name.zh: 創業之品牌管理與行銷
name.en: The Brand Management and Marketing of Entrepreneurship

notes: 106-108：創新與創業選修。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 因是在大專教藝術欣賞的課程，我在設計課程上，即考慮雖同學們不是藝術本科學生，但秉持 "雖創作，但會欣賞的原則"，我的課程安排將從上古時代人類的美術創作活動進而引導解釋什麼是人類的美感經驗。讓他們明瞭東方藝術之同與不同，再介紹東西方的繪畫潮流，如西方：從文藝復興至寫實主義，印象主義，至超印象主義，東方：從漢的畫象磚開始至中國畫，書法之演進，中西繪畫之比較，內容是繁而多的。但我將用簡潔扼要的 "重點教學法", 寓教於樂的方式，讓同學不再懼怕 "Art'，甚至可以簡單的分辨出藝術品的年代，作者，及欣賞藝術作品的要領，這是我給此門課所訂的目標。另一個教學重點是：" 理論和實際併重 "。在每一單元中，我將設計一項簡的 [自己動手做] 大概祇花 20-30 分鐘讓學生體會和真正看見，明白，藝術家製造藝術品的過程。很希望能帶學生至博物院或美術館一趟，或至鶯砍參觀陶工廠。總之，一切課程計劃，乃配合學生之程度與興趣。
description.en: Because most students taking this course are not art major; therefore, I adhere to the principle of "Although not creation, appreciation will be instructed."  On course design, my class starts from the artistic creation of human beings in prehistoric time and further introduces the experience of beauty sensed by man and understand the similiar and difference of eastern and western art.  Moreover, I will introduce the fashion of priniting of eastern and western culture.  For example, the western culture: from the Renaissance to realism, impressionism and super impressionism.  Western culture: from a portrait stone of Han Dynasty to Chinese painting, the develpment of calligraphy and comparison of Chinese and western paintings. The teaching content is complicated, but I will simply it and highlight teaching way to let my students enjoy it.

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 本課程是為非專業學生所設計的哲學概論，介紹西洋哲學的起源、西洋哲學的問題，以及哲學與人生的關係。哲學的問題意識起自人類的自覺，人類意圖認識自己，為宇宙人生尋求解答，哲學的發生本自人類天賦的求知欲，即其本性中對於智慧的追求與愛慕。這種愛慕智慧的精神是希臘文明留給西方世界的遺產，對於知識能持客觀批判的精神，對於真理能存認真熱切的態度，對於人生能有超克苦難的修持。在國際化的世代，我們對西方的認識應更深入其精神層面，此乃本課程規劃的初衷。
description.en: This course is designed for student who is not disciplined in philosophy. As an introduction, we begin at the origin of western philosophy, the philosophical questions and finally, the relationship of human life and philosophy. Philosophy takes place when human being thinking of himself. Man by nature desire to know himself as well as the external world. And due to this love of wisdom, men can be critical to knowledge and be passionate toward truth. Eventually, grasping the sprit of western philosophy , we can view our life in quite a different view. In our time, facing the world of international, we should better understand the western culture, which is rooted in philosophy.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 本課程，擬引領修課同學們徜徉古今愛情文學作品；內容含括詩、詞、散文、小說、戲曲、視聽影像等，並以主題單元方式進行之。從中，仔細咀嚼或清澀曖昧、或清新動人、或可歌可泣、或刻骨銘心、或纏綿悱惻、或黯然銷魂的愛情文學作品；從中，與作品中所傳達的心情、心事、心聲產生共鳴，由此來發現：在塵世的繁華裡，情感的傳遞是沒有時空隔閡，是可以心心相映。鑑於修課同學正值青春年華、正將展翅翱翔，因此本課程除了鑑賞、品味古今愛情文學作品，並欲與吾人現實人生作一連結，由此思考愛情、婚姻、兩性、家國、社會、政治等議題，由此尋求愛情的本質與真諦。
description.en: The course to be taught to lead students know the love of ancient and modern literature; content encompasses poems, prose, fiction, drama, music, video works, etc., and will be conducted in a manner theme unit. From this, clear astringent taste ambiguous, fresh and moving, epic, unforgettable, deeply grieved and other types of love literature. In the process, the works convey mood, thoughts, aspirations, etc. to produce spiritual resonance. Thus to discover: In dust, there is no time and space to pass emotional estrangement, is matched heart.As the students is young, will start his life being so understanding of the course in addition to the love of ancient and modern literature, and our desire to make a real life connection. Thus thinking love, marriage, gender, home country, society, politics and other topics. Thus, the nature and essence of seeking love.

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 本課程目標如下：（一）以心理學為基礎，探討人類生活各面向的知識；（二）建立學生生活行為的技能；（三）促使學生建立自己積極的價值體系。  本課程內容涵蓋人類的個體發展、學習方式、動機、情緒、態度、人格、兩性、愛情、家庭、育兒、健康管理、社會行為等生活面的相關行為。  本課程採學生中心教學法，以啟發法、小組討論、創造式發表等方式授課，藉以活潑學生的思考並增加學生上台練習的機會。
description.en: The objectives of this course are : (1)By basing on the psychology   to guide our students to discuss the variant facets of their lives. (2)To establish the students' good skills to deal with their own lives. (3)To found the students' positive value systems .  This course includes the human behaviors of individual development , learning strategies, motivations, emotion, attitudes, personality, social interaction, religious lives, love, bisexual interaction, family lives, children cultivation , and etc. This course uses the learner-centered instructing strategies. The methods of discovery learning, teams discussion, creative teaching , and etc. will be adopted, in order to excite the students to do deep thought and give them the opportunities to show their efforts and achievements themselves.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 人際關係是探討對自我的了解及對人的認知，包括性格、態度、魅力、溝通、壓力、挫折和情緒等重要課題的處理；幫助同學學習與各種不同品味、信念、立場與生活方式的人作有效率的溝通，開放的表達出自己的感覺與想法，以建立良好的合作關係，從而開發潛能、爭取更好的發展機會。
description.en: Interpersonal Relationship is to discuss about self-understanding and perception of other people, including how to handle key issues related to character, attitude, attractiveness, communication, pressure, frustration and emotion.  It helps students to learn effective communication, open their minds to express personal feeling and thought, and try to communicate with other people having different tastes, convictions, standpoints and ways of living so as to establish a harmonic and cooperative relationship and furtherly to develop personal potential and strive for better opportunity of development.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 每個人都不想孤獨地活著，學習建立親密關係是幸福的來源。本課程透過講解、討論、體驗、分享，幫助學生認識自己，發揮最大潛能，懂得溝通連結，能處理情緒與壓力，尊重個別差異與性別平等，從而尋覓最對的人。在親密關係中鼓勵彼此做最真最喜歡的自己，也樂於分工合作，建立最美好的家庭，進而活出有意義有價值的人生。本課程是真正的成年禮，從自我到互依，是成長與成熟的必修課。
description.en: Nobody wants to live a lonely life. Having an intimate relationship is a source of happiness.In this course, students will be given a skill set for understanding themselves, exploring their potential and managing emotional stress. They will also learn to communicate and connect with others through personal sharing, group discussions and in-class exercises. Issues like individual difference and gender equality will be emphasized, since respecting each other is the base for any good relationship, not to mention finding the right partner.It is only when both partners are true to themselves and like the way they are in the relationship will they be willing to share the hard and fun work of building a family and living a meaningful life together.One can see this course as a rite of passage into adulthood.  It is a prerequisite for growing mature, from being self-centered to being able to rely on one another.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 本課程名稱為 “環境與自然保育” 。它包括二大範疇：(1) 自然環境和自然資源的保育，(2) 自然環境的保存、維護、利用、復原及改良。它將教導學生下列主題：自然保育的基本概念（自然保育的定義、自然保育觀念的發展）、保育生物學（物種形成和滅絕、生物多樣性、物種保護的優先原則、生物入侵）、生態經濟學簡介（生態經濟學的原則、能量流與物質流分析）、自然保護區（自然保護區之概念、自然保護區的保護對象）、自然保育政策（國際自然保育策略、台灣的自然保育機構及相關法規）與自然保育運動（自然保育運動之發展、當前自然保育運動所關心的事）。整體而言，本課程期盼提升公民生態意識和環境覺知，使大家對環境保育做出更多貢獻。
description.en: The title of this course is “Environment and Nature Conservation”. It includes two categories: (1) conservation of the natural environment and natural resources, and (2) the preservation, maintenance, restoration and improvement of the natural environment. It will introduce to students the following themes: basic concepts of nature conservation, conservation biology, introduction to ecological economics, nature reservation, nature conservation policy, and nature conservation movement. As a whole, it aims to raise our citizens’ ecological consciousness and environmental awareness and thus enable them to make more contribution to the conservation of our environment.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 新創事業面臨許多的挑戰，包括：避孼與大企業競爭，找到存活的依據、從無到創立強勢品牌、創立或擴張自有市場 / 消費者據點等。本課程旨在啟發修課同學創業的興趣並協助修課同學思考新創事業如何平衡有限資源以迎向挑戰。新創企業已發展成熟的企業是不一樣，主要是因為新創事業的資源有限，創業家必須同時兼顧許多面向並回應顧客所需。本課程旨在協助修課同學思考創建企業應注意的各種面向評估自己的創能力。課程包含了三大部份，第一部份為創新與創業概念啟發；第二部份在辨別市場機會與發展市場；最後第三部份為新創事業行銷管理。行銷活動能夠將企業的產品及服務傳遞給顧客；並將產品、服務及企業本身的資訊帶到市場上；將顧客資訊回饋給企業。創業行銷管理能夠幫助創業者向潛在投資者及企業夥伴銷售創意以獲得資源，也讓創業家透過創新的商業手法來充分利用稀少的資源。
description.en: Managers must have excellent leadership skills in order to A start-up company has lots of challenges, such as: niche market located and brand diffusion. The course intends to encourage the participant to become an entrepreneur and handle with these challenges. A start-up company is different from well-developed one due to limited resources. Usually, to response customer’s requirement, the entrepreneur must take multiple criteria into consideration simultaneously.    The course includes three parts. Part I build students’ concept about innovation and entrepreneurship. Part II is about market identification. Part III is about marketing management of a start-up company. The efficient marketing activities enable business to approach customer’s requirement, to bring their customer product (or services) and get customer’s feedback. Also, the marketing management helps entrepreneur to reach their potential investor to obtain more resources.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業核心。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 在上學期開設，一學期，兩學分。斷限：始於日據時期，止於七十年代，以台灣白話文學之生發演進史程為主軸。範圍：涵蓋文字改革運動，第一次鄉土文學論戰，第二次鄉土文學論戰，  本土化文學思想研析、及作品選讀。要求：學期報告一份、期末考。
description.en: Period: From the Japanese sovereighty to the 1980's; emphasizing the history of the vernacular literature. Topics: The movement of the language revolution; the first controversy of folk literature; the second controversy of folk literature; analysis of the literary localization movement and the study of selected works.Requirements: One term paper and a final exam.

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 「生活美學」是現代人依據東西方文化及各方美學的定義所推論出來的名詞，指應用於「生活」中食、衣、住、行、育、樂所體現美的內容及活動。依循相異的生活型態、社會環境，人類試圖重構生活藝術化與藝術生活化的當代美學。
description.en: “Aesthetics of living " will address the East-West cultural and aesthetic experience through series of questions that drive the discourse in contemporary life’s content and activities. Following the different lifestyles, social environment, human tries to reconstruct everyday life into contemporary aesthetics of living. This course aims to encourage students to think what is aesthetic of living, through the real life and spiritual life and concerned itself with the aesthetic problems in the lives of others.

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 本課程目標如下：（一）以心理學為基礎，探討人類生活各面向的知識；（二）建立學生生活行為的技能；（三）促使學生建立自己積極的價值體系。  本課程內容涵蓋人類的個體發展、學習方式、動機、情緒、態度、人格、兩性、愛情、家庭、育兒、健康管理、社會行為等生活面的相關行為。  本課程採學生中心教學法，以啟發法、小組討論、創造式發表等方式授課，藉以活潑學生的思考並增加學生上台練習的機會。

(2)To establish the students' good skills to deal with their own lives. (3)To found the students' positive value systems .  This course includes the human behaviors of individual development , learning strategies, motivations, emotion, attitudes, personality, social interaction, religious lives, love, bisexual interaction, family lives, children cultivation , and etc. This course uses the learner-centered instructing strategies. The methods of discovery learning, teams discussion, creative teaching , and etc. will be adopted, in order to excite the students to do deep thought and give them the opportunities to show their efforts and achievements themselves.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 以攝影來進行社會介入的創作作品，在當代藝術的領域中已經不再陌生，而這樣的發展也促成在社會學領域中越來越多關於攝影與社會的討論。本課程主要分為兩大部分，第一部分將從攝影史發展脈絡，來談攝影的社會使用，第二部分則是探討在當代藝術中，如何將攝影作為一種社會實踐的方式。除課堂講解和集體討論外，本課程也將透過實作討論同學的攝影計畫和作品，期使讓同學對於攝影，可以產生新的社會性思考，並開始進行影像與社會介入的嘗試。
description.en: In the field of contemporary art, photography has been developing into a way of social intervention. This trend also contributes to triggering more dialogues concerning “photography and society” in the discipline of sociology. The course mainly includes two parts: photography history and the photography as a social practice. In the first section, along with the history of photography, the social usages of photography will be introduced. In the second section, how photography art can be a social practice and what kinds of practice have been explored will be . In addition to class lectures and group discussions, the course requires all students to complete their individual photo project in the end of semester and their works will be presented in class.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 每個人都不想孤獨地活著，學習建立親密關係是幸福的來源。本課程透過講解、討論、體驗、分享，幫助學生認識自己，發揮最大潛能，懂得溝通連結，能處理情緒與壓力，尊重個別差異與性別平等，從而尋覓最對的人。在親密關係中鼓勵彼此做最真最喜歡的自己，也樂於分工合作，建立最美好的家庭，進而活出有意義有價值的人生。本課程是真正的成年禮，從自我到互依，是成長與成熟的必修課。
description.en: Nobody wants to live a lonely life. Having an intimate relationship is a source of happiness.In this course, students will be given a skill set for understanding themselves, exploring their potential and managing emotional stress. They will also learn to communicate and connect with others through personal sharing, group discussions and in-class exercises. Issues like individual difference and gender equality will be emphasized, since respecting each other is the base for any good relationship, not to mention finding the right partner.It is only when both partners are true to themselves and like the way they are in the relationship will they be willing to share the hard and fun work of building a family and living a meaningful life together.One can see this course as a rite of passage into adulthood.  It is a prerequisite for growing mature, from being self-centered to being able to rely on one another.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 在日常生活中經常會見到統計的應用，在讀取許多統計數據之時，我們必須要具有基本的統計概念才不會被數據所誤導。本課程利用 Excel 統計分析的功能，介紹基本的統計方法，藉由生活中應用之實例，將問卷設計、資料蒐集與分析、統計結果之解釋等，做一系列之介紹。
description.en: We usually use statistics in our daily life, but in many cases, we should have basic statistic concept, otherwise we maybe misleading by the data.  In this lesson, we use statistic analysis function of Excel as a useful tool.  Introduce basic method of statistic, show the procedure of questionnaire design, data collection and analysis, explanation of result etc., by use the example in our daily life.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 新創事業面臨許多的挑戰，包括：避孼與大企業競爭，找到存活的依據、從無到創立強勢品牌、創立或擴張自有市場 / 消費者據點等。本課程旨在啟發修課同學創業的興趣並協助修課同學思考新創事業如何平衡有限資源以迎向挑戰。新創企業已發展成熟的企業是不一樣，主要是因為新創事業的資源有限，創業家必須同時兼顧許多面向並回應顧客所需。本課程旨在協助修課同學思考創建企業應注意的各種面向評估自己的創能力。課程包含了三大部份，第一部份為創新與創業概念啟發；第二部份在辨別市場機會與發展市場；最後第三部份為新創事業行銷管理。行銷活動能夠將企業的產品及服務傳遞給顧客；並將產品、服務及企業本身的資訊帶到市場上；將顧客資訊回饋給企業。創業行銷管理能夠幫助創業者向潛在投資者及企業夥伴銷售創意以獲得資源，也讓創業家透過創新的商業手法來充分利用稀少的資源。
description.en: Managers must have excellent leadership skills in order to A start-up company has lots of challenges, such as: niche market located and brand diffusion. The course intends to encourage the participant to become an entrepreneur and handle with these challenges. A start-up company is different from well-developed one due to limited resources. Usually, to response customer’s requirement, the entrepreneur must take multiple criteria into consideration simultaneously.    The course includes three parts. Part I build students’ concept about innovation and entrepreneurship. Part II is about market identification. Part III is about marketing management of a start-up company. The efficient marketing activities enable business to approach customer’s requirement, to bring their customer product (or services) and get customer’s feedback. Also, the marketing management helps entrepreneur to reach their potential investor to obtain more resources.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業核心。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 透過一系列的資料採集、參考與互動，包含經驗分享、影片欣賞等，帶領修課同學探索創新（Innovation）、創業（Startup）以及最重要的 – 創業家創新精神（Entrepreneur Innovative Thinking）之本質。無論是工作上的創造，學習上的創造，或者是 (創) 事業上的創造，都必然需要一定程度的創新，才能在全球化競爭以及指數型科技（Exponential Technology）發展的趨勢下存活，最終獲得勝利、創造價值。
description.en: Through series of classes to train students embracing the innovative thinking and gradually internalize it to become innovative entrepreneurship. Since the generation is changing so rapidly, the competitors are no longer came from local land but from everywhere in global village. Under this highly competitive world, every one of us need to fully embrace the true value of innovation, and incubate our own entrepreneurship with hack spirit, which will lead us to an island of innovation.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業核心。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 本課程以培養學生尊重與欣賞不同族群、不同時空、不同價值觀所產生的音樂而設。藉由對音樂元素、本質的認知及介紹，欣賞各時期作曲家之代表作品，培養西方音樂的基本常識，建立音樂欣賞的專業態度。教學目標：1. 提高學生音樂欣賞的素養，充實其音樂生活的內涵，2. 激發學生對音樂的興趣，培育愛樂人口，增進社會祥和的原動力，3. 介紹古今中外音樂名家名作，啟發學生對音樂創作的認知與敬重，4. 建立學生對古典音樂、民族音樂、應用音樂及通俗音樂等不同類型音樂的正確認知與包容力，培養世界性的音樂觀。授課內容：1. 概論，2. 歌樂，3. 器樂，4. 儀式音樂，5. 舞蹈音樂，6. 戲劇音樂。
description.en: This course aims to cultivate students' ability to appreciate music of different ethnic groups, different time and place, different value systems. Through the introduction of basic music elements as well as the appreciation of the masterpieces of various composers, it is hoped that students will build up basic music knowledge about music and enhance professional music appreciation potentiality in music. The goals include: 1. Elevating students' capability in music appreciation 2. Inspiring students' interest in music with a view to improving our society into a harmonious world. 3. Introducing domestic and international famous composers' pieces 4. Touring of various forms of music: classical, ethnic, applied and popular music. Contents of this course include: 1.Introduction 2. Vocal music 3. Instrumental music 4. Ritual music 5. Dance music 6. Theatre music

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 因是在大專教藝術欣賞的課程，我在設計課程上，即考慮雖同學們不是藝術本科學生，但秉持 "雖創作，但會欣賞的原則"，我的課程安排將從上古時代人類的美術創作活動進而引導解釋什麼是人類的美感經驗。讓他們明瞭東方藝術之同與不同，再介紹東西方的繪畫潮流，如西方：從文藝復興至寫實主義，印象主義，至超印象主義，東方：從漢的畫象磚開始至中國畫，書法之演進，中西繪畫之比較，內容是繁而多的。但我將用簡潔扼要的 "重點教學法", 寓教於樂的方式，讓同學不再懼怕 "Art'，甚至可以簡單的分辨出藝術品的年代，作者，及欣賞藝術作品的要領，這是我給此門課所訂的目標。另一個教學重點是：" 理論和實際併重 "。在每一單元中，我將設計一項簡的 [自己動手做] 大概祇花 20-30 分鐘讓學生體會和真正看見，明白，藝術家製造藝術品的過程。很希望能帶學生至博物院或美術館一趟，或至鶯砍參觀陶工廠。總之，一切課程計劃，乃配合學生之程度與興趣。
description.en: Because most students taking this course are not art major; therefore, I adhere to the principle of "Although not creation, appreciation will be instructed."  On course design, my class starts from the artistic creation of human beings in prehistoric time and further introduces the experience of beauty sensed by man and understand the similiar and difference of eastern and western art.  Moreover, I will introduce the fashion of priniting of eastern and western culture.  For example, the western culture: from the Renaissance to realism, impressionism and super impressionism.  Western culture: from a portrait stone of Han Dynasty to Chinese painting, the develpment of calligraphy and comparison of Chinese and western paintings. The teaching content is complicated, but I will simply it and highlight teaching way to let my students enjoy it.

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 台灣科技發展史將討論二十世紀前半（1900-1950）部份重要技術引入台灣後，造成的影響與社會變遷。依時間先後，先從農業技術的變革 - 綠色革命。其次研讀有關電力與水利的技術發展，然後進入工業化初期的台灣社會變遷，以及二次大戰期間軍需工業所引導出的初期重化工業。除了這些技術與產業變革之外，也將兼論及技術人物群像與職業教育的開端。
description.en: The main topics for class will discuss the important technology how to influence Taiwan society during 1900-1950. This class includes some important developments: Green revolution -it discuss about agriculture development; the technology development of electricity and water conservancy. In some topic we discuss about Taiwan society change in early days industrialization and chemical industry during world war II. Except those topics, technologists and the beginning of professional education in Taiwan will be introduced.

name.en: The Development of Taiwan Technology History

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 婚姻是一般人所必經的過程，家庭是生活的場所，關係著人生的幸福與美滿。本課程強調美滿婚姻與幸福家庭是一門學問，因此，課程內容包括：對婚姻與家庭有正確的認知、積極的態度、完整的規劃，並培養有認真努力去實踐的方法與能力。如何追求真正的快樂與幸福？除了在婚姻與家庭中追求平等化、合理化、自由化、公平化外，自我成長、相互尊重都是本課程的學習目標，以協助學生思考婚姻與家庭的終生大事。
description.en: Marriage is a process that most people will go through.  Family is where you belong to, and where the satisfaction and happiness come from. We believe that it is a kind of scholarship to have a high-quality marriage and a wonderful family.  The contents of this course include having the correct understanding of marriage and family, cultivating positive attitude, developing complete plans, and realizing them with all efforts. This course will help students think totally about marriage and family, learn to pursue equality, reasonableness and liberty, keep growing and respect each other, so that we can obtain the real delight and happiness.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 此門課程主要在於瞭解社會學的意涵，並藉由跨領域的學習，讓不同學科能有對話的空間。課程涵蓋的範圍會兼顧理論與實用性，讓學生能思考當今的社會，理解到產生因素的多元性，並進而使個人眼界能更加開拓。期望學生於課程學習中能夠擁有更多對於整個社會的不同思維，以強化本身學科之所需，不但具有理論性深入的洞察力，也能引用到管理上實質的層面。
description.en: The purpose of this course is to understand sociology. It covers theory and practicability, and make students consider the current society, and understand the generated factors of diversity . Expect students' study can have more for the community as a whole different way of thinking, in order to strengthen their academic needs, not only has the theoretical depth of insight, but also on the substance applied to the management level.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學核心。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 每個人都不想孤獨地活著，學習建立親密關係是幸福的來源。本課程透過講解、討論、體驗、分享，幫助學生認識自己，發揮最大潛能，懂得溝通連結，能處理情緒與壓力，尊重個別差異與性別平等，從而尋覓最對的人。在親密關係中鼓勵彼此做最真最喜歡的自己，也樂於分工合作，建立最美好的家庭，進而活出有意義有價值的人生。本課程是真正的成年禮，從自我到互依，是成長與成熟的必修課。
description.en: Nobody wants to live a lonely life. Having an intimate relationship is a source of happiness.In this course, students will be given a skill set for understanding themselves, exploring their potential and managing emotional stress. They will also learn to communicate and connect with others through personal sharing, group discussions and in-class exercises. Issues like individual difference and gender equality will be emphasized, since respecting each other is the base for any good relationship, not to mention finding the right partner.It is only when both partners are true to themselves and like the way they are in the relationship will they be willing to share the hard and fun work of building a family and living a meaningful life together.One can see this course as a rite of passage into adulthood.  It is a prerequisite for growing mature, from being self-centered to being able to rely on one another.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 運動、營養與健康是目前先進國家相當關注之理念與課題，也是提升生活品質與開發個人潛能的有效方法。本課程將有系統的介紹健康的生活方式與規律適度的運動，並將著重於如何將運動學與營養學之學理與技術，適當應用於個體健康生活整體之營造，使修課學生能了解運動前後的均衡飲食與擁有健康。
description.en: Exercise, nutrition and health is very concerned about the idea of advanced countries and issues, but also an effective way to develop individual potential and quality of life improved. This course will introduce a healthy lifestyle with moderate exercise system of law, and will focus on how the theoretical and technical kinematics and nutrition, the proper individuals applied to create a healthy life as a whole, so that students can enjoy the sport taught , and have a healthy balanced diet.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 本課程是教授學生人工智慧的基本概念與應用，激發學生在人工智慧領域的創新應用。課程內容包括：人工智慧基礎、機器學習、大數據技術、深度學習、生成對抗網路、創業家思維、設計思考、商業模式、人工智慧與現代科技、人工智慧的製造業應用、人工智慧的服務業應用。
description.en: This course is to teach students the basic concepts and applications of artificial intelligence and to inspire students for innovative artificial intelligence applications. The course includes: artificial intelligence basics, machine learning, big data, deep learning, generative adversarial network, entrepreneurial thoughts, design thinking, business models, artificial intelligence and modern technologies, industrial applications of artificial intelligence, and services applications of artificial intelligence.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業選修。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 首先介紹歌劇中音樂的元素、本質及角色，欣賞各時期不同類型之歌劇作品，繼由「世界三大男高音」看歌劇曲目的走向，吸引新生代同學對歌劇之響往，帶領愛樂者進入歌劇欣賞的境界。
description.en: This one-semester course is designed to let students learn:  1.to approach to their first opera with open minds and open ears 2. to understand what opera is.  3. to know the essential elements of opera－composers and librettists,  singers, conductors, directors, as well as designs and expenses,...etc.. 4.to understand the development of opera 5.to appreciate opera through watching films of various kind 6.to be able to enjoy opera for the rest of their life.

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 因是在大專教藝術欣賞的課程，我在設計課程上，即考慮雖同學們不是藝術本科學生，但秉持 "雖創作，但會欣賞的原則"，我的課程安排將從上古時代人類的美術創作活動進而引導解釋什麼是人類的美感經驗。讓他們明瞭東方藝術之同與不同，再介紹東西方的繪畫潮流，如西方：從文藝復興至寫實主義，印象主義，至超印象主義，東方：從漢的畫象磚開始至中國畫，書法之演進，中西繪畫之比較，內容是繁而多的。但我將用簡潔扼要的 "重點教學法", 寓教於樂的方式，讓同學不再懼怕 "Art'，甚至可以簡單的分辨出藝術品的年代，作者，及欣賞藝術作品的要領，這是我給此門課所訂的目標。另一個教學重點是：" 理論和實際併重 "。在每一單元中，我將設計一項簡的 [自己動手做] 大概祇花 20-30 分鐘讓學生體會和真正看見，明白，藝術家製造藝術品的過程。很希望能帶學生至博物院或美術館一趟，或至鶯砍參觀陶工廠。總之，一切課程計劃，乃配合學生之程度與興趣。
description.en: Because most students taking this course are not art major; therefore, I adhere to the principle of "Although not creation, appreciation will be instructed."  On course design, my class starts from the artistic creation of human beings in prehistoric time and further introduces the experience of beauty sensed by man and understand the similiar and difference of eastern and western art.  Moreover, I will introduce the fashion of priniting of eastern and western culture.  For example, the western culture: from the Renaissance to realism, impressionism and super impressionism.  Western culture: from a portrait stone of Han Dynasty to Chinese painting, the develpment of calligraphy and comparison of Chinese and western paintings. The teaching content is complicated, but I will simply it and highlight teaching way to let my students enjoy it.

notes: 106-108：美學與藝術選修。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 歷史相關研究蓬勃發展迄今，不論是史料或新舊的研究著作重新被重視、翻譯與詮釋，這些可稱之為史學著作的經典。這些書籍既有趣味又有意義，捧而讀之，中西歷史、古往今來的風物民情、地貌變遷等流轉仿彿躍於紙上。本課程將介紹這些經典的、趣味的、有意義的歷史名著，藉由數本好書，進而瞭解人類的歷史。
description.en: Since the study of the history has been in prosperity, a large number of historical texts have been newly translated and interpreted, thus gaining more importance. These texts can be categorized as classical volumes of history . There have been existent a lot of other written resources interesting and meaningful exhibiting the vivid image of the people, geography, folk stories and the transition of time available in history. This course focuses on these particular materials concerning the human history through the discussion of which, the history of mankind can be better understood.

notes: 106-108：歷史與文化核心。109 (含) 後：人文與藝術

description.zh: 婚姻是一般人所必經的過程，家庭是生活的場所，關係著人生的幸福與美滿。本課程強調美滿婚姻與幸福家庭是一門學問，因此，課程內容包括：對婚姻與家庭有正確的認知、積極的態度、完整的規劃，並培養有認真努力去實踐的方法與能力。如何追求真正的快樂與幸福？除了在婚姻與家庭中追求平等化、合理化、自由化、公平化外，自我成長、相互尊重都是本課程的學習目標，以協助學生思考婚姻與家庭的終生大事。
description.en: Marriage is a process that most people will go through.  Family is where you belong to, and where the satisfaction and happiness come from. We believe that it is a kind of scholarship to have a high-quality marriage and a wonderful family.  The contents of this course include having the correct understanding of marriage and family, cultivating positive attitude, developing complete plans, and realizing them with all efforts. This course will help students think totally about marriage and family, learn to pursue equality, reasonableness and liberty, keep growing and respect each other, so that we can obtain the real delight and happiness.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 此門課程主要在於瞭解社會學的意涵，並藉由跨領域的學習，讓不同學科能有對話的空間。課程涵蓋的範圍會兼顧理論與實用性，讓學生能思考當今的社會，理解到產生因素的多元性，並進而使個人眼界能更加開拓。期望學生於課程學習中能夠擁有更多對於整個社會的不同思維，以強化本身學科之所需，不但具有理論性深入的洞察力，也能引用到管理上實質的層面。
description.en: The purpose of this course is to understand sociology. It covers theory and practicability, and make students consider the current society, and understand the generated factors of diversity . Expect students' study can have more for the community as a whole different way of thinking, in order to strengthen their academic needs, not only has the theoretical depth of insight, but also on the substance applied to the management level.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學核心。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 以攝影來進行社會介入的創作作品，在當代藝術的領域中已經不再陌生，而這樣的發展也促成在社會學領域中越來越多關於攝影與社會的討論。本課程主要分為兩大部分，第一部分將從攝影史發展脈絡，來談攝影的社會使用，第二部分則是探討在當代藝術中，如何將攝影作為一種社會實踐的方式。除課堂講解和集體討論外，本課程也將透過實作討論同學的攝影計畫和作品，期使讓同學對於攝影，可以產生新的社會性思考，並開始進行影像與社會介入的嘗試。
description.en: In the field of contemporary art, photography has been developing into a way of social intervention. This trend also contributes to triggering more dialogues concerning “photography and society” in the discipline of sociology. The course mainly includes two parts: photography history and the photography as a social practice. In the first section, along with the history of photography, the social usages of photography will be introduced. In the second section, how photography art can be a social practice and what kinds of practice have been explored will be . In addition to class lectures and group discussions, the course requires all students to complete their individual photo project in the end of semester and their works will be presented in class.

notes: 106-108：社會與哲學選修。109 (含) 後：社會與法治

description.zh: 植物與人類生活息息相關，人類選擇植物加以栽培生產，用來提供食、衣、行、及健康所需，而農耕的發達則與人類文化及社會的演變互相影響。本課程將由各種不同角度介紹，包括植物特性、栽培管理技術、自然環境、地理、人文、社會、政治、經濟等方面，與植物生產的關係。主旨希望同學能了解人類與植物間相依相存的關係，並進一步關懷人類、植物、與自然環境之間的相處之道。
description.en: Plants supply major food for all kinds of living organisms.  This lecture is prepared to introduce the relationship between the crop plant and modern food  production.  The whole spectrum will be viewed from the aspect of the chacteristics of platns, the nature environment, science, human civilization, society, politics and economics, etc..  Hope students can concern and respect the mutuality between plants and human.

notes: 106-108：自然與科學選修。109 (含) 後：自然與科學

description.zh: 創業與財務概論課程的主要目的是要使學生了解如何在企業創立的時候，透過財務技術，來評估企業的經營績效與價值。本課程將介紹以下內容：(1) 公司創業的財務報表與科目報導與分析 (2) 基本創業財務分析理論 (3) 公司的償債能力、獲利能力、經營能力、資本結構、現金流量的分析 (4) 特殊行業的財務報表分析 (5) 探討我國最近發佈的會計準則公報對企業與投資人的影響。
description.en: The goal of the introduction to entrepreneurship and finance course is to help students, when the company is in the stage of entrepreneurship, evaluate the performance and measure the values of firms by financial statements. The topics of this course includes (1) entrepreneurship financial reports and analysis; (2) basic entrepreneurship financial statement analysis; 3) solvency, profitability, business performance, financial structure and cash flow analysis; 4) financial statement analysis of special industries 5) recent developments of GAAP.

notes: 106-108：創新與創業選修。109 (含) 後：創新與創業

description.zh: 台灣科技發展史將討論二十世紀前半（1900-1950）部份重要技術引入台灣後，造成的影響與社會變遷。依時間先後，先從農業技術的變革 - 綠色革命。其次研讀有關電力與水利的技術發展，然後進入工業化初期的台灣社會變遷，以及二次大戰期間軍需工業所引導出的初期重化工業。除了這些技術與產業變革之外，也將兼論及技術人物群像與職業教育的開端。
